content: https://chat.zulip.org/help/ now has a new design with the index on the left-hand side.
I think we'll want to do some further work on the /help/ homepage (thoughts on what should go there are welcome!), but I'd love feedback on the new design and any issues you can find :)
The left sidebar is super slick! I feel like the "Documentation home" link is in a slightly awkward place now.
Hmm, yeah, do you think we should just get rid of the "Documentation home" link part?
I think it'd be less awkward if we removed that
I feel like the left sidebar is a little big, but that's my preference
I could also imagine moving the "Zulip is open source ..." piece to be attached to the footer.
I also would like to be able to click the whole <li> instead of only the link <a>
Hmm, yeah, that last one seems like a bug. @Joshua Pan can you fix or open an issue?
One thing that strikes me is that it's probably high time to do another round of organization on the links.
I agree with @Joshua Pan that the left sidebar is almost kind of overpowering.
not sure we want to remove the Home link based on my first impression...just a data point

The thing that I'm always expecting to see but don't is a search bar---especially with that extra empty space in the top-center now and the left sidebar making the UI look more like the Zulip web app anyways, the lack of a search function is more visually glaring (if slightly less UX-annyoing because of the sidebar)
MS Paint mockup of what I'm thinking of:Screenshot-2017-07-14-10.48.53.png
Even though I'm logged in the page shows "Login | Register"

@Rohitt Vashishtha yeah, that last bit is actually true for all of our logged-out / portico pages. I think it's probably time that we displayed the fact that you're logged-in there. Would you be up for opening an issue? It's not specific to the /help/ page.
@James Rowan the main challenge with adding a "search" feature is that search is a decent amount of work to implement :)

Well, I guess actually there may be versions of the form site:<current domain> that one can attempt using Google? Anyway probably worth opening an issue for "help search" and we can try to figure out what the easiest solution is.
opened #5803 (search in help)
opened #5804
Yay, thanks folks :)
Now that we have a sidebar, I think it'd be kinda cool if we could have a collapsible sidebar like we do with the topics (click on a section and all the related articles dropdown)
Hmm, I'd want to be careful about that sort of change until we have some sort of search; right now it's pretty handy that you can ctrl-f on the page to find things in the index :)

Hii ,
I would like to work on following project in GSOC 2018.
Visual design work on Zulip’s logged-out pages, including /help, /apps, /integrations, /api, /login, /register, the zulip.org website, etc. We’d love to make these look nicer both through polish and potentially through adding fun illustrations to make the product more friendly. A project could include work on Zulip’s logged-in UI as well.

I want to ask whether I should install the whole development (Vagrant and other ) or should I work directly on Zulip.org websites as it is a part of design only. Your guidance means a lot. Thanks
Hey! I would recommend installing a complete Zulip instance as that would get you familiar with the overall architecture, and the logged out pages we mention are a part of the core web app.
The Zulip website, however, is outside of the core repo.
